body_content.explanation: an occasion when a group of people go around a public place picking up litter (= small pieces of rubbish lying on the ground):
examples: We are arranging a litter pick round the centre of the village on Saturday 3rd April.
The 30 youngsters took up plastic sacks and gloves as part of a three-day litter pick.

body_content.explanation: a device like a long stick with two parts on the end that can be opened and pressed together using a handle at the top of the stick, in order to pick up small pieces of rubbish from the ground, or a stick with a point on the end that can be used to do this:
examples: Street sweepers carry their litter picks in plastic bags.

body_content.explanation: to go around a public place picking up litter (= small pieces of rubbish lying on the ground):
examples: An army of volunteers are engaged to litter pick.
Making sure that the area is litter picked to perfection, volunteers collect rubbish and send what they can to be recycled.
Do your bit for the environment on Cairngorm by litter-picking on the mountain in the Big Spring Clean.
